intro: Phaeomeria pallida, commonly known as the pale phaeomeria, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a shallow root system adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. Phaeomeria pallida is often found in open grasslands and is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
